text: The men's discus throw competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was John Powell of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |71.16 |Berlin, Germany |August 9, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |62.36 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Mac Wilkins | |63.30 |GR |- | |Bradley Cooper | |62.16 | |- | |Luis Delís | |61.60 | |- |4 |Juan Martínez Brito | |60.80 | |- |5 |Boris Chambul | |59.42 | |- |6 |Robert Gray | |54.30 | |- |7 |Gert Weil | |43.24 | |- | |Pedro Serrano | | | |- | |Ken Stadel | | | |- | |Luis Palacios | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
